channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thursday Briefing: An Impeachment Motion in South Korea
item.description: Plus, what’s your favorite holiday tradition?

item.title: How South Korea's Impeachment of President Yoon Could Happen
item.description: A detailed look at each stage of the impeachment process, and what is to come for President Yoon.

item.title: Europe’s billionaires—who pay their family office CEOs just $370,000 a year—are worried they can’t find the talent to manage their fortunes
item.description: Europe's ultra-wealthy need to find staff from outside the family as younger generations forge their own path.

item.title: Trump Picks Frank Bisignano to Lead Social Security Administration
item.description: Frank Bisignano has spent his career at major Wall Street banks. He has a long history of political giving, mainly to Republicans.

item.title: Kelly Powers, Fox News Commentator Who Shared Her Health Crises With Viewers, Dies at 45
item.description: She was diagnosed with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer, in 2020, and used her platform to talk about cancer research.

item.title: Home Depot accused of faking Black Friday deals by masking original prices with holiday sale stickers showing the same cost
item.description: The retailer hasn’t responded, but the alleged “pricing shenanigans” are just the latest example of how some shoppers think Black Friday is a farce.

item.title: 64-year-old Simon Cowell, who doesn’t work Fridays, says he’s ‘not going to bet the house’ on Gen Zers who refuse to take calls over the weekend
item.description: 64-year-old Cowell has quit Fridays, answering late emails, and his phone in search of a better work-life balance, but doesn't expect Gen Z to do the ...

item.title: South Korea’s Defense Minister Steps Down Over Martial Law Decree
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol accepted the resignation of Kim Yong-hyun, who said he took responsibility for the crisis caused by the brief imposition of mi...

item.title: Rohit Bal, Exuberant Star of Indian Fashion, Dies at 63
item.description: Known as “the bad boy of fashion,” he was among a wave of designers who created modern Indian couture by updating traditional garments.

item.title: Marine Le Pen Is Holding France Hostage
item.description: The government’s fall shows the strength of the far right.

item.title: Gunman Shoots 2 Kindergartners at Rural Christian School in Targeted Attack
item.description: The gunman at the Feather River Adventist School in Oroville, Calif., later died of what appeared to have been a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the aut...

item.title: Bitcoin Price Surges to a Milestone: $100,000
item.description: The price of a single Bitcoin rose to six figures for the first time, an extraordinary level for a 16-year-old cryptocurrency once dismissed as a side...

item.title: Europe has caught a workplace absenteeism bug, turning one of the continent’s biggest advantages into a multi-billion euro strain
item.description: The factors driving sick leave culture differs depending on where you look, but are linked to mental health, welfare benefits, and cultural factors.

item.title: Thursday Briefing
item.description: Here’s what you need to know.

item.title: China warns against ‘worship’ of chasing faster economic growth
item.description: “If we do not get rid of the ‘worship of speed’ mindset...we will be taking an overdraft from the future,” the official Xinhua News Agency wrote in a ...
